summary: TL* THE CONTACT OWNS A 2013 HEARTLAND ROAD WARRIOR EQUIPPED WITH TOWMAX POWER KING TIRES, TIRE SIZE 235/80/16. THE CONTACT STATED THAT WHILE DRIVING APPROXIMATELY 65 MPH, THE FRONT PASSENGERS SIDE TIRE POPPED. THE VEHICLE WAS NOT TAKEN TO A DEALER. THE TIRE WAS NOT REPLACED. THE MANUFACTURER WAS MADE AWARE OF THE FAILURE. THE VEHICLE AND TIRE FAILURE MILEAGE WAS 3,000.

WHILE DRIVING ON I-75 IN FLORIDA, LESS THAN 20 MILES INTO THE DRIVE, I HAD A BLOWOUT CAUSING 4000 DOLLARS WORTH OF DAMAGE TO THE TRAILER. THE TIRE WAS A POWERKING TOWMAX 235/80/R16. THE TIRE PRESSURES WERE VERIFIED AT 80 PSI BEFORE THE TRIP. THESE ARE THE ORIGINAL TIRES THAT CAME ON THE RV WHEN I BOUGHT IT NEW, AND THERE WERE NO OBVIOUS SIGNS OF WEAR BEFORE THE TRIP. THESE TIRES ARE DANGEROUS AND NEED TO BE TAKEN OFF THE ROAD.  *TR
